author: KHOU
title: President Trump calls Gov. Abbott to voice support for school voucher bill - NewsBreak
text:
Texas
President Trump calls Gov. Abbott to voice support for school voucher bill
13 minutes ago
AUSTIN, Texas — Texas lawmakers spent Wednesday debating Senate Bill 2, the state's proposed school voucher program. Earlier in the day, President Donald Trump called Gov. Greg Abbott to tell him he supports the bill and hopes lawmakers vote to pass it. Abbott posted a video of the phone call on X.

author: Enviroliteracy Team
title: Why is tilapia soggy?
text:
Why Is Your Tilapia Soggy? Mastering the Art of Cooking This Popular Fish Tilapia, that mild-flavored, readily available fish, can be a weeknight dinner savior. But sometimes, it ends up…soggy. What gives? The primary culprit behind soggy tilapia is excess moisture . This can stem from several factors: improper thawing, insufficient drying before cooking, overcrowding the pan, or even overcooking. Understanding these factors and knowing how to combat them is crucial to achieving perfectly cooked, flaky tilapia every time. Let’s dive deep into the reasons and solutions for achieving perfect tilapia.
Understanding the Root Causes of Soggy Tilapia Several intertwined factors can contribute to that undesirable soggy texture. Here’s a breakdown:
1. Improper Thawing Techniques The Freeze-Thaw Cycle: Tilapia is often sold frozen. When frozen, water within the fish forms ice crystals. If thawed too quickly (e.g., in the microwave or at room temperature), these ice crystals melt rapidly, releasing water into the fish’s flesh. This excess water dilutes the fish’s natural proteins, leading to a mushy texture after cooking. The Remedy: The gold standard for thawing frozen tilapia is slow thawing in the refrigerator. Place the frozen fillets in a leak-proof bag or container and allow them to thaw overnight (or for at least several hours) in the fridge. This allows the ice crystals to melt gradually, minimizing water damage to the fish’s structure. 2. Insufficient Drying Before Cooking Surface Moisture is the Enemy: Whether you’re using fresh or properly thawed frozen tilapia, surface moisture is your enemy. Water on the surface of the fish will steam rather than sear when it hits the hot pan, hindering browning and leading to a soggy result. The Solution: Pat it Dry!: Before cooking, meticulously pat the tilapia fillets dry with paper towels. Press firmly but gently to absorb as much surface moisture as possible. This step is crucial for achieving that beautiful sear and preventing a mushy texture. 3. Overcrowding the Pan Steam Bath, Not a Sear: When you overcrowd the pan, the temperature of the oil plummets, and the tilapia ends up steaming instead of searing. All that released moisture has nowhere to escape, leading to a soggy, unevenly cooked result. The Fix: Cook in Batches: Cook the tilapia in batches, ensuring there’s ample space between each fillet. This allows for even cooking, proper browning, and the evaporation of excess moisture. 4. Overcooking Dried Out and Then Soggy: Ironically, overcooking tilapia can also contribute to a soggy texture. When tilapia is cooked for too long, its protein structure breaks down, releasing moisture and resulting in a dry then mushy consistency. The Key: Time and Temperature: Tilapia cooks quickly! Aim for a final internal temperature of 145°F (63°C). Use a meat thermometer to ensure accuracy. Look for the fish to become opaque and flake easily with a fork. 5. Low-Quality Tilapia Not All Tilapia is Created Equal: The quality of the tilapia itself plays a significant role in its texture. Poorly raised or improperly stored tilapia is more likely to have a mushy or undesirable texture. Source Matters: When possible, opt for sustainably sourced tilapia. Consider the growing environment, water quality, and feed. The Environmental Literacy Council , available at enviroliteracy.org , offers valuable information about sustainable seafood choices and the environmental impact of aquaculture. Mastering the Art of Cooking Tilapia: Tips and Tricks Beyond avoiding the pitfalls mentioned above, here are some additional tips for perfectly cooked tilapia:
Choose the Right Cooking Method: Pan-searing, baking, grilling, and broiling are all excellent methods for cooking tilapia. Each method offers unique flavor and texture profiles. Use High Heat: Whether you’re pan-searing, grilling, or broiling, use high heat to achieve a beautiful sear and prevent the fish from sticking to the pan. Don’t Flip Too Early: Allow the tilapia to sear properly on one side before flipping. This will ensure even cooking and a beautiful golden-brown crust. Season Generously: Tilapia has a mild flavor, so don’t be afraid to season it generously with your favorite herbs, spices, and marinades. Lemon juice, garlic, paprika, and black pepper are all excellent choices. Be Mindful of Acidic Marinades: While marinades can add flavor, be cautious with acidic ingredients like lemon juice or vinegar. Extended exposure to acid can denature the proteins in the fish, leading to a mushy texture. Marinate for no more than 30 minutes. Use the Right Cookware: Stainless steel or cast-iron cookware is ideal for pan-searing tilapia on the stovetop. These materials distribute heat evenly and help create a beautiful sear. Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs) About Tilapia 1. Why is my tilapia slimy? A slimy texture in raw tilapia is a telltale sign that it has gone bad. Other indicators include a sour or “fishy” smell and an opaque color. Do not consume slimy raw tilapia.
2. Is it safe to eat mushy fish? As long as the flesh is still firm (despite being somewhat mushy) and the skin is shiny, the fish is likely safe to eat. However, if the fish smells strongly of ammonia, is excessively mushy, or otherwise questionable, discard it. When in doubt, throw it out.
3. Should I rinse tilapia before cooking? Food safety experts generally advise against rinsing raw fish before cooking. Rinsing can spread bacteria around your kitchen.
4. Why does tilapia have a weird taste sometimes? An off-flavor in tilapia is often attributed to microorganisms in the water where it was raised, such as algae and bacteria. This can result in an earthy, musty, or muddy taste.
5. How can I get the muddy taste out of tilapia? Soaking tilapia in milk for about 30 minutes before cooking can help reduce the muddy taste. You can also try marinating it with lemon juice or strong herbs.
6. Is mushy fish undercooked? Not necessarily. Mushiness is more often associated with improper thawing or overcooking. Undercooked fish will be translucent and resist flaking.
7. Is mushy fish overcooked? Yes, overcooked fish can become mushy as the protein structure breaks down.
8. How can you tell if tilapia is undercooked? Undercooked tilapia will be translucent and resist flaking easily with a fork. Its internal temperature will be below 145°F (63°C).
9. How can you tell if tilapia is overcooked? Overcooked tilapia will be dry, flaky, and potentially rubbery or mushy. The flesh may also ooze white albumin.
10. What are the symptoms of eating bad tilapia? Scombroid poisoning, which can occur from eating improperly stored fish like tilapia, can cause flushing, nausea, vomiting, hives, and abdominal pain within 20-30 minutes of consumption. Seek medical attention if you experience these symptoms.
11. How long can you keep cooked tilapia in the refrigerator? Cooked tilapia can typically be stored in the refrigerator for up to 3-4 days.
12. Can you freeze cooked tilapia? Yes, you can freeze cooked tilapia, but the texture may be slightly altered upon thawing. Consume frozen cooked tilapia within 2-3 months for best quality.
13. What is the best way to cook tilapia to avoid sogginess? Pan-searing with high heat and ensuring the fish is thoroughly dried beforehand is an excellent method for avoiding sogginess.
14. What is the ideal internal temperature for cooked tilapia? The ideal internal temperature for cooked tilapia is 145°F (63°C).
15. Is organic seafood better? The term “organic” is not currently regulated for seafood in the United States. However, looking for sustainably sourced seafood from reputable suppliers is a good way to ensure quality.
By understanding the science behind soggy tilapia and implementing the tips and tricks outlined above, you can consistently achieve perfectly cooked, flaky, and delicious tilapia that will impress your family and friends. Happy cooking!

author: user
title: Anthropologist Bernard Saladin d'Anglure dies at 88
text:
Anthropologist Bernard Saladin d’Anglure dies at 88
Bernard Saladin d’Anglure, born in France in 1936, spent most of his life researching Inuit culture. He passed away in Toulouse, France, on Feb. 12 at age 88. (Photo courtesy of the Government of Canada)

author: 小浪财讯
title: 智能电动车ETF（516380）跌0.54%，半日成交额18.76万元|智能电动车_新浪财经_新浪网
text:
6月19日，截止午间收盘，智能电动车ETF（516380）跌0.54%，报0.738元，成交额18.76万元。智能电动车ETF（516380）重仓股方面， 比亚迪 截止午盘跌1.40%， 宁德时代 跌1.13%， 立讯精密 跌0.58%， 汇川技术 跌0.05%， 长城汽车 跌0.47%， 韦尔股份 涨0.27%， 三花智控 涨3.26%， 科大讯飞 跌0.55%， 拓普集团 涨1.99%， 亿纬锂能 涨0.35%。
智能电动车ETF（516380）业绩比较基准为中证智能电动汽车指数收益率，管理人为华宝基金管理有限公司，基金经理为陈建华，成立（2021-06-04）以来回报为-25.82%，近一个月回报为-4.59%。
